pullRequest.body:
Given a weight `w : σ → M`, where `M` is an additive and commutative monoid, we endow the
  ring of multivariate polynomials `MvPolynomial σ R` with the structure of a graded algebra

Co-authored-by: Antoine Chambert-Loir  <antoine.chambert-loir@u-paris.fr>

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

bors d-antoine
bors d-=antoine
bors d-
Sorry for the confusion, I think I delegated the wrong person and I am trying to make sure I am revoking the delegation.
bors d=AntoineChambert-Loir

:v: AntoineChambert-Loir can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10080707036/job/27871073768)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10080707036/job/27871074020)

Can you add a docstring explaining what to do to get the `GradedAlgebra` instance (with the usual weights) on multivariate polynomials? I mean something like
```
attribute [local instance] MvPolynomial.gradedAlgebra
```
Thanks!

bors d+

Can you add a docstring explaining what to do to get the `GradedAlgebra` instance (with the usual weights) on multivariate polynomials? I mean something like
```
attribute [local instance] MvPolynomial.gradedAlgebra
```
Thanks!

bors d+
This uses `weightedGradedAlgebra`, which has a `DecidableEq R` instance - is this avoidable at all?
Good point, thank you. We have removed some instances `DecidableEq R` and `DecidableEq \sigma` which were only used in proofs.
Should this be called `coeAlgEquiv`?
Probably we just want `variable {β}` starting from before `of_eq_same`. I think lots of these theorems have it too explicitly.

```suggestion
variable {M S : Type*} [DecidableEq ι] [DecidableEq M] [AddCommMonoid M] [SetLike S M]
    [AddSubmonoidClass S M] (A : ι → S)
    
```

```suggestion
/-- The canonical isomorphism of an internal direct sum with the ambient algebra -/
```

```suggestion
such that `DirectSum.IsInternal M` (`A` is the direct sum of the `M i`),
```

```suggestion
The submodules are the *homogeneous* parts. -/
```
Could you either remove, or add an explanatory note why this is present but commented out?
Is this name right? I'm not sure what the principle is here.
Replaced by `HomogeneousSubmodule.gradedMonoid`.

```suggestion
/-- The decomposition of `MvPolynomial σ R` into homogeneous submodules -/
```

```suggestion
abbrev decomposition :
```
Similarly here, I guess. What is the naming scheme?
I have renamed this to `WeightedHomogeneousSubmodule.graded_monoid`.
Maybe `f` should be explicit here (and below)?
These comments seem to have been forgotten.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(RingTheory.MvPolynomial.WeightedHomogeneous): add graded algebra structure
